metadata.title: CVE-2024-38619 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:usb-storage: alauda: Check whether the media is initialized The member"uzonesize" of struct alauda_info will remain 0 if alauda_init_media()fails, potentially causing divide errors in alauda_read_data() andalauda_write_lba(). - Add a member "media_initialized" to structalauda_info. - Change a condition in alauda_check_media() to ensure thefirst initialization. - Add an error check for the return value ofalauda_init_media().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-262-generic - 4.4.0-262.296
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-262-generic - 4.4.0-262.296
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-262-lowlatency - 4.4.0-262.296
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-lowlatency - 4.15.0-232.244~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1140-kvm - 4.4.0-1140.151
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1176-aws - 4.15.0-1176.189~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1184-azure - 4.15.0-1184.199~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1108-fips - 4.4.0-1108.115
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1108-fips - 4.4.0-1108.115
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1108-fips - 4.4.0-1108.115
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1108-fips - 4.4.0-1108.115
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-262.296').

linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1140.151').

linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1184.199~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1108.115').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1169.186~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
